intro: Unonopsis leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaved unonopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and glossy in appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or yellowish and appear in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
